website_summaries.verdict: This is a reliable smart dimmer that can be easily added to a 3-switch setup without changing out other switches.
pros: Switch remembers last light setting after being turned off
Can be added into 3-switch plate without replacing other 2-light switches
Allows for quick and easy installation
Compatible with 500-watt single lights, 400-watt 2-gang incandescent lights, and 150-watt CFL or LED lights
cons: Standard cover plate screws are not the correct size for this light switch

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, except in multi gang box. Still doable, though.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a dozen of these to go install around the house. With a little research, the was able to make good sense of a simple dipole installation. No trouble pairing with my hub, except for one case. Contacted tech support who got right back to me, but the problem mysteriously resolved itself. Still a little intimidated by the prospect of the 3-way installation, so maybe I'll update once I've done one of those. Had trouble getting them to fit into a 3-gang box, but fixed it by cutting the tabs off the heatsink with a pair of tin snips. I figure if they're all touching each other, they form one big heatsink and it's probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gareth

customer_reviews.title: Works with Home Assistant, AEON Labs ZW090 Z-Stick and a Raspberry Pie 3b
customer_reviews.text: I bought several dimmers and a switch on Prime day to automate the majority of led lights in my house. These work great with Home Assistant, an AEON Labs ZW090 Z-Stick, and a Raspberry Pie 3b. They all show up in Apple's Homekit through Home Assistant. I did run into a problem where one of my led lights did not like the dimmer, so I had to swap things around. Unless the LED lights say they are dimmable, purchase the switch instead of the dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: kakaratto

customer_reviews.title: I got one bad Zooz dimmer
customer_reviews.text: People say its the same as a ge switch but holding them in your hand you can tell the ge is solid..I got one bad Zooz dimmer ..You can turn it on by pressing the button but turning off you have to press it with all your might to get it to shut off..They do work well and pair up easy with a vera plus...I also have some on/off zooz switches that work very well ...Just got two if the newer in wall dimmers.. and paired the up to a vera secure..Took seconds and the process was perfect..The dimmers seem to be better than the older ones...These are worth the money and they work great with a vera system..
customer_reviews.author: Len Ricupero

customer_reviews.title: Good price, Easy setup and Worked as instructed
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitated to buy this dimmer switch just because I have never heard of Zooz. However after purchased and received the switch, the installation and setup to my existing smartthings hub were really easy and worked as expected. Very good price, however it did not come with cover plate which mean you have supply your own but it was nice that they included an extra neutral wire (white) pre-stripped on both ends so you do not have buy then just tap to your existing neutral and tape it.
customer_reviews.author: Minh D.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my Wink hub v1. The dimming speed is a little slow for my liking and it would have been nice if something like "double tap" for maximum brightness were available instead of holding and waiting for it to go full bright. I had to rewire the switch with 3 wire Romex because the original switch was just fed with 2 wire to cut the hot wire to the lights. Lucky for me it was easy to access.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service + very good switch.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service. There were few minor thing to adjust on the unit and customer service was excellent to respond to all my questions. Unit works perfectly Samsung Smarthings, very easy to add. Only thing I don't like much was the dimming rate when turning the light on/off too slow for my taste but after my request, the company looked into it and will consider making it faster or adjustable on oncoming versions.
customer_reviews.author: P.L

customer_reviews.title: Great Zwave Product
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in my Zwave network! Nice to not have to wire in the other side of the 3 way switch. Note though that although you dont need an add-on switch like other brands, you do still have to rewire that box. But, Zooz provided great instructions to help. Update: The three-way function is hit-and-miss. Sometimes flipping the normal switch will properly trigger the on/off, sometimes it doesn't and I have to flip it again or walk over to the actual Zooz switch. I'll probably be replacing this with the actual GE three-way/add-on setup, as those have never failed to act properly.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Pairing challenges
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Zooz 3-way switch. I learned how to wire it on the first one, so it was fast to install the second one. Trouble came when it was time to pair it. I have spent a fair amount of effort trying to get it to pair, with no luck. Will call for support on Monday. But still... not impressed! I am not in a position to get my SmartThings controller any closer than about 40 feet, line of sight, so it may just be that it doesn't have the range.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moeglein

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with ELV devices
customer_reviews.text: ZooZ has an outstanding support team and they worked hard to help me get the switch wired correctly in a 3-way set up, but unfortunately we discovered that it causes my LED chandelier to make an annoying buzz. Apparently the switch is not compatible with Electronic Low Voltage (ELV) devices, even if they are dimmable. Before buying this switch, check the specifications for your device / lights carefully to make sure that they are compatible. Although the switch did not work for me, I am rating it 4 stars because it is othewrise an excellent switch, and the customer support is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Torchstar  ultra thin lighting
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd switch and for some reason this one turns off abruptly and the other 2 dim slowly when turning off. Interested in keeping scenes the same this wasn't to my liking but I think i might still be able to program that out using the SmartThings hub. Aside from that these work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Tried to replace a couple switches with this and it never worked. GE comparable dimmer switches do work so I know it’s not my wiring. Can’t return after 90 days so stuck with something I never could get working.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fare

customer_reviews.title: No wiring pigtails but work great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace some Insteon dimmers. They work well so far and paired perfectly to my Hubitat Hub. They don't have wiring pigtails like the Insteon dimmers so I had to make a few. It does come with a short pigtail for the neutral. I plan to pick up a few more when they are on sale again. I only installed them in a single-pole scenario. Next install will be for a 3-way switch. Some commented that they switches feel cheap. I don't think they feel any different then the Insteon ones I replaced. Also it's a smart switch so my whole purpose installing these is to never touch the physical paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Works well with google voice controls via smart things hub v2.
customer_reviews.text: Requires a neutral (white wire) - get something like a Lutron Caseta if you have an older building. Used in a single pole environment, no three-way switch. Installation took about 15 min and worked with my existing Halogen PAR30LN bulbs. Switched over to some EcoSmart PAR30L dimmable LED bulbs with no problems. They were easily added to my z-wave hub (Samsung Smart Things Hub V2) which is connected to my Google Home App. There is no perceptible hum or issues with this setup. We will probably pick up a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: Works, both single and 3 way
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few 3 way switches, so this working with a regular 3 way on the other side was attractive to me. It does indeed work.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ZWave Dimmer Switch
customer_reviews.text: Got this switch today and installed it in about 5 minutes. Works like a charm, giving instant status reporting to my ISY hub (the best hub). The blue sentinel light is a bit bright at night and when I wrote to Zooz customer service I received a reply within 3 hours, letting me know how to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Mazal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the S2 switch to install in a 4 way light circuit. This switch is great, no need to re-wire anything. Dropped it in and applied power. Works great on my LED flood lights and there is zero flicker at low levels. As any of my General Electric Zwave switches fail they will be replaced with the Zooz S2.
customer_reviews.author: Stan555

customer_reviews.title: Nope don’t order it
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 3 weeks and just failed. Found that the lights just turned off for no reason. Switch is dead. The whole “you get what you pay for” rings true.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very nice build quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing has such nice build quality, and works great! There are so many parameters that I can configure this switch to do anything I could possibly want! I am so happy with this product I will certainly be purchasing more of their product lines!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Porche

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, but buzzes.
customer_reviews.text: Zwave dinner works well. Directions easy to follow. Price is very enticing. Only issue I have is that it buzzes when dimming. It buzzes more when slightly dimming and almost none when near fulling dim and and full on. It’s seems my lights also buzz, but the buzzing got worse when I replaced my old dimmer with this one. Considering if I want to buy more or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works really well with LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: I use these switches with Home Assistant, using an Aeotec Z-Wave stick. I have one GE brand switch, and a few of these Zooz switches. The button feel on the Zooz is much better in my opinion. The GE feels a bit mushy and you have to press harder.
customer_reviews.author: hotelmode

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected. The old dimmer was not able to handle the LED bulbs without flickering- the Zooz dimmer had no problem with the LED's. Make sure to know what each connection is -- line, load, traveler (if 3 way), neutral and ground. Will make change out easier. Expect to buy and install more as $$$ allows.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Switch works perfect and great support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the ZEN 22 Zooz switches. One of them was going into a three-way setup and upon opening the boxes it was very confusing how I needed to wire the switches. I sent Zooz support pictures and within a few hours had a response back on how they needed to be wired, and it worked flawlessly. The switches work great manually and were easy and quick to set up with Smartthings. I'll be purchasing more of these as I build out my smart home.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: ok, if it worked
customer_reviews.text: i set it all up after much trouble then once it was on i found out when i pressed the switch up it wouldn't turn on, it was stuck in place. So i had to remove and return, kind of a waste of time. i ended up going with another brand that is much easier to wire that uses a hub and the switches aren't as bulky. If the switch worked it would probably be 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Best Z-Wave available
customer_reviews.text: These switches are great. With just a single Zooz switch you can incorporate them into a 3-way wiring design w/out having to replace the other "already installed no name" switch. Unlike the competition, they don't force you into buying a "dummy" switch for a 3 way that costs another $20.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bronder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dimmer switch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dimmer switch. Easy to configure in Smartthings. The best feature is that they can be used with "dumb" 3-way switches, unlike most z-wave switches, which require companion switches. One disadvantage is that they cannot be configured (as far as I can tell) for instant-on, instant-off, which would allow for use with non-dimmable lights. Not an issue for me, as I want the dimming function.
customer_reviews.author: Sherwin A.

customer_reviews.title: I have been filling my house with zooz switches and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been filling my house with zooz switches and dimmers. As long as the situation does not call for motion detection, in which case I go for the GE motion switches and dimmers. These zooz devices pair and operate great
customer_reviews.author: S. PHILLIPS

customer_reviews.title: Flickers.
customer_reviews.text: This dimmer would be great if it didn't flicker. I tried with two different brand LED lights, using their recommended brand on the second go around. They flicker at any setting below 50% or so. Everything else about the dimmer seems to work, but let's be honest, who cares if it can't dim the lights properly?
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Petrucci

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic smart switch.
customer_reviews.text: I love this switch. Does all it says it does without being complicated to use, easy to set up in Smart Things hub, decent ship time, looks and feels high quality for the best price out there that has the features this switch has. I will be purchasing this brand of smart switch from now on. Would absolutely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Waidelich

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised at half the price of other brands.
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can do 3 way, without needing to buy a second switch. My only complaint is that there is no instant on/off, it dims to on or off. Works with Smartthings, but if you want advanced features you need to install a custom handler, which can be intimidating if you're not technical.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn's Finest

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!  Stacks up with the more expensive options!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a handful of Z-Wave switches and the Zooz brand stacks up evenly with the more expensive options. I've installed a handful of these Zooz switches in my house and setup has been extremely straight forward. I haven't had any issues whatsoever since I installed them a month ago. I will, definitely, be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Bappy

customer_reviews.title: Save $20 bucks on add-on switches
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works as advertised, and has good illustrations in the instructions. The only downside is that is Can only be dimmed from one side because it uses an existing 3-way switch. Not terribly importmant for most installs in my opinion especially with alexa/google Home
customer_reviews.author: Alonzo Poach

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I'm using this item as a three way ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'm using this item as a three way switch. I'm able to use this dimmable switch with my regular switch. This switch is cheaper than the other competitors, and I did not have to buy an add-on switch.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer321

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I have purchased multiple GE smart switches ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I have purchased multiple GE smart switches and they work well, I decided to try this one out because it was $10 cheaper. They do not have as satisfying of a "click" when I use the switch itself, but that is such a minor issue that it does not bother me at all. This product works very well and I plan on buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Zooz product and all is well with my Z Wave system (eight devices and growing). Easy to setup and my system recognized it with no problems. I'll update this post should anything change (problems).
customer_reviews.author: soaknewe (so can you)

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: These Zooz switches are awesome and work better than the GE/Jasco and at a much better price
customer_reviews.author: CDoubleDiddy

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: had to figure the wiring in the house out first. used in a string of three switches. can be a little confusing but google wiring diagrams to find out where to place it with the right wires. works great with google home
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Unity out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Would work with Z-Wave, but not the physical switch. Worked with tech support and they sent the latest version to me for free, very happy with Zooz.
customer_reviews.author: DanRockies

customer_reviews.title: Three way capability without proprietary remote paddle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent switch for the cost. Ive been on the hunt for a three way solution that didnt cost $60, and found it here. Works great with SmartThings, and gives a more finished result than just over priced smart bulbs, without having to buy a proprietary remote paddle switch for three way applications.
customer_reviews.author: RickStock

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice dimmer switches
customer_reviews.text: This is the 6th ZEN22 I've purchased. These are really nice dimmer switches. My favorite part is the 3-way with existing switch on the other side. These integrated very easily in to my ST hub. I highly recommend these for anyone looking for a smart switch/dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: NO companion switches required! Does not work with GFCI.
customer_reviews.text: This product was recognized by Smartthings V2 hub and works as advertised with existing "dumb" switches in a 3-way and 4-way setup. It does require a neutral wire for connection. THIS PRODUCT HAS ISSUES WITH GFCI CIRCUITS! I origionally wanted to use it to control an outdoor outlet which requires a GFCI circuit. The switch would trip the GFCI before you can even get it to pair. I ended up moving it to another location which doesn't require GFCI and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these switched and they are very easy to install. They work with a 3 way circuit without changing the other switches which simplifies everything.
customer_reviews.author: Bronsom

customer_reviews.title: Very well done.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy install, once I actually paid attention to the directions. Basically one of the travelers acts as the load pass-through. Love the fact that I can use my existing "other" switch in my three way setup. Installed to Oomi system no problem, and now my kitchen lights that are recessed LEDs are on my smart home system. You do need the neutral wires in your wiring though.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction, wire connection slips from connectors. Will not be recognized by smartthings hub, even if 2 ft. away. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: MontiMas

customer_reviews.title: Works but the lights fade in/out when toggling.
customer_reviews.text: This product works as expected however I was not a fan of the fade in/out effect that could not be changed. I used it in a 3-way setup and everything worked well. When installing you have to make sure the load and line connections are correct otherwise you will be in troubleshooting hell.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R. Koepke

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble getting the switch installed on a three way application so I contacted customer support and they were awesome! They answered my emails right away no matter what time of day or night and were very knowledgeable with helping getting the switch wired correctly. The switch works great in my application and would definitely recommend the product if you are creating a smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 3-way switch
customer_reviews.text: The best 3 way z-wave switch I have used. Wiring was very easy and the switch works perfectly. This is the first Zooz switch I have used, I am real impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Thurmond

customer_reviews.title: Very nice packaging.  Worked like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice packaging. Reminiscent of unpacking an iPhone! Worked like a champ. Put into a 3-gang box and lived! LOL.
customer_reviews.author: mBrane

customer_reviews.title: So far it has been working great. I just ordered 4 more of the on/off ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been working great. I just ordered 4 more of the on/off switches for other parts of my home.
customer_reviews.author: Titan325

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Did not even work as a switch, let alone a Z-wave controller. Tightening screws did not lock wires in place. Total junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pair and works every time. I will be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great dimmer. Quick updates and response. Works great with smartthings.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and works great. Took me more time to disconnect the old switch then to install this switch. The button to release the wire wouldn’t budge....cheap builder grade garbage. The zooz was a snap to wire up. Pairing was easy with my VeraPlus.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great smart switches, especially for 3-way circuits
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with the first one of these I bought that I bought four more. Straightforward install and easy link up with Wink hub2. Love that these support three-way circuits without additional hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but lastet only one year
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the fact, that these switches work with regular 3-way switches. But it, unfortunately, lastest only a little over one year.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Really good smart switch. Reliable and quick and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Logan C.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works good no issues. Dims LED bulbs good and communicates fine with my Simon XTi panel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: Using several of these with the Aeotec Z-Stick Gen5, Z-Wave Plus USB and Home Assistant/Hassio on Raspberry Pi 2. Working great!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The switch to get with a 3 way
customer_reviews.text: Wow, install was fairly simple and it was nice not having to replace the 3 way switch. This switch acts just like a regular dimmer when not paired to a hub. Paired to my SmartThings hub and everything just works. I see no reason to buy any other smart dimming switch.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rynerson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice features and as easy to install as a normal switch
customer_reviews.author: jarel

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk!! It never worked! Don’t buy it unless you just feel like throwing money away.
customer_reviews.author: A Duenes

customer_reviews.title: Save you money but you pay in the long run.
customer_reviews.text: For being v2 devices, the range on these are no better than v1 and actually probably worse. I had a GE v1 switch right next to one of these and the switches would regularly be unreachable I thought it was the v1 GE switch acting as a repeater for the ZOOZ in the mesh but when I replaced it with another Zooz switch, neither were ever reachable again after pairing. Ended up having to put a repeater nearby to get them to work again.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBobJimboBob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working grate nice not to have to buy another $40 switch to do 3 way setup
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first day, so I bought a second ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first day, so I bought a second one. Then it started dropping off the network. The second one had the same problem too. So I returned them both and bought the GE versions, which oddly look exactly, and I mean EXACTLY, the same. However the GE's are running zigbee, which has been more reliable at my house, as my other products are all zigbee, so the mesh is stronger. I also like the zigbee product's ability to reset their connections from the device. I have not had much luck with reconnecting ZWave devices as the exclusion process is unforgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Demestihas

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good price, easy to pair with my Hubitat Elevation hub.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Warren

product_meta.title: Zooz Z-Wave Plus Wall Dimmer Switch ZEN22 (White) VER. 3.0, Works with Existing Regular 3-Way Switch (Z-Wave Hub Required)
product_meta.description:
Style:Wall Dimmer Switch ZEN22

 * NOTE: Check Wattage first: DON'T exceed 300-500 W for incandescent and 150 W for LED's. Do NOT connect this dimmer to chandeliers, ceiling fans, motors, or home appliances
   NEUTRAL WIRE REQUIRED
 * 
 * 
 * SPECIFICATIONS:Model Number: ZEN22 VER. 3.0Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHzPower: 120 VAC, 60 HzMaximum Loads: 500 W Incandescent with all heat sink tabs on (400 W with one side off, 300 W with both sides off), 150 W LED'sZ-Wave Range: Up to 100 feet line of sight between the Z-Wave hub and the closest Z-Wave repeaterOperating Temperature: 32-104° F (0-40° C)Installation and Use: Indoor only
   
   Will it work with Alexa?
   Amazon Echo is not Z-Wave controllers so you will need a compatible Z-Wave hub to control this switch with your smart speaker.
   Alexa-compatible Z-Wave hubs include:
   Fibaro Home Center LiteHubitatSmartThingsVeraPlusWink
feature_bullets: SMART DIMMING: Control your lights and adjust brightness remotely through Z-Wave. Works with good quality LED's (120 VAC only, no 0-10V control) and incandescent bulbs! Hub required (sold separately), scroll down for compatibility. Voice control only available with Alexa-compatible Z-Wave hub (will NOT work directly with smart speakers).
DIRECT 3-WAY SOLUTION: No add-on switch needed! Use it with regular on/off switches (NO dimmers) in your 3-way set-up. Connection to power and NEUTRAL required (check your boxes before buying).
RELIABLE AND DURABLE: Reports status instantly. Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure. Covered under 1 year warranty and lifetime tech support. ETL listed.

BONUS FEATURES: Double tap to full brightness (single tap to last brightness level). Z-Wave Plus signal repeater, adjustable LED indicator (change mode straight from the switch!). Scene control on select hubs (program up to 10 scenes!).

COMPATIBLE: Officially certified to work with SmartThings. This dimmer will be recognized by any Z-Wave hub that supports multilevel devices (other dimmers), including Wink, Vera, Home Assistant, HomeSeer, Fibaro Home Center Lite, ADT Pulse, Vivint, and others (advanced settings may not be available).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars160 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
